author: Staff Reporter
text:
Silver anklet unit owners and labourers were asked to carry sufficient documents while transporting silver and gold items or cash when the model code of conduct is in force during the Assembly elections.

The Election Commission has made it mandatory that traders need to carry supporting documents if they carry jewellery or cash of more than Rs. 50,000 failing which the items or cash will be seized.

On Wednesday evening, a meeting was held at the Collectorate in which the owners represented their grievances.

They said that there were no valid documents for receiving job orders and also they carried cash for purchasing silver bars.

Hence, they wanted the norms to be relaxed.

However, Election Officer and Collector V. Sampath told them that carrying valid documents was necessary and asked the owners and traders to follow the norm.
title: ‘Carry valid documents’
